data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
Which compound was obtained as a crystalline material suitable for single-crystal X-ray analysis?
What is the coordination geometry around zinc in compound 4?
Is the coordination environment of zinc in compound 4 entirely made up of two pyridyl aminoiminophosphoronate ligands?
What is the role of 4,4‘-bipyridine in the formation of compound 3?
data.answer: It assists the formation of a polymeric zigzag structural arrangement.

data.question: Does compound 5 involve the pyridyl nitrogen atom in conjunction with the amido nitrogen for coordination?

What is the space group of compound 3?
Does the reaction of compound 1 with n-butyllithium or methyllithium lead to the formation of compound 6?
What is the role of the pyridyl substituents in the ligand system?
data.answer: They alter and augment the coordination capability of the ligand system.

data.question: Is the coordination behavior of the ligand toward alkaline earth metal ions different from that toward Zn2+ ion?
What is the formula weight of compound 4?
Can the NP(R2)N- chelating anionic ligand be converted into a Janus face NP(Py2)N- tripodal ligand?
What is the crystal system of compound 5?
Does the substitution of the organic alkyl or aryl groups by two pyridyl groups in the ligand lead to the possibility of forming heterobimetallic complexes?
What is the role of the amino hydrogen atom in compound 1?
data.answer: It is involved in the formation of the metallacycle.

data.question: Is the reaction of compound 1 with organolithium reagents or bis(trimethylsilyl)lithium amide complex?
What is the empirical formula of compound 3?
What is the significance of the pyridyl substitution in the reactivity of aminoiminophophoranes?
data.answer: It facilitates single or even double P=N bond cleavage.
